aors.module.physics.collision
Class IntervalList

java.lang.Object
  aors.module.physics.collision.IntervalList

public class IntervalList
extends java.lang.Object

A list of interval bounds used for 1D collision detection. An interval represents the space a physical object covers. The start and end point of each interval are kept in the list.

Constructor Summary
IntervalList(java.util.List<Physical> objList, GeneralSpaceModel spaceModel)
          Creates an IntervalList from a list of Physicals.

          Checks if any collisions occur (this includes perceptions as well).

          Removes the endpoints belonging to the given object.

Constructor Detail

IntervalList

public IntervalList(java.util.List<Physical> objList,
                    GeneralSpaceModel spaceModel)
Creates an IntervalList from a list of Physicals. Determines the interval endpoints of every object and stores it in the list. The x-coordinate of the objects is used. (This is the constructor for the continuous space)

Parameters:
objList -
spaceModel -
Method Detail

detectCollisions

public void detectCollisions(java.util.List<Collision1D> collisionList,
                             java.util.Set<Perception1D> perceptions,
                             java.util.Set<Physical> borderReached)
Checks if any collisions occur (this includes perceptions as well). The "sort-and-sweep" algorithm is used here to determine overlapping intervals.

Parameters:
collisionList - - list where all detected collisions are saved
perceptions - - set where all detected perceptions are saved
borderReached - - list where all objects, that have reached the space border, are saved

add

public void add(Physical object)
Add an object to this list. This will add two endpoints for the object and in case of an agent two endpoints for its perception radius to the list.

Parameters:
object -

remove

public void remove(Physical object)
Removes the endpoints belonging to the given object.

Parameters:
object -

update

public void update(java.util.Map<Physical,java.lang.Double> newPositions)
Updates the List with the values of the map. (used in continuous space)

Parameters:
newPositions -
